keyword: how many calories in reeses peanut butter cup
title: How Many Calories in a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in Reese's peanut butter cup, plus full nutrition breakdown including carbs, fat, protein, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup?
assumptions: Standard single milk chocolate Reese's Peanut Butter Cup (about 21 g), no additional toppings or modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, exact size, recipe changes, and storage; always check packaging for precise values.

quick_answer.text: One Reese's Peanut Butter Cup contains about 90 kcal, with 2 g protein and 10 g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in one Reese's peanut butter cup?
faqs.a: Approximately 90 kcal per standard single cup.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a Reese's peanut butter cup?
faqs.a: About 10 g total carbs, including 9 g sugars and 0.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is there protein in Reese's peanut butter cups?
faqs.a: Yes, around 2 g protein per cup from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a Reese's peanut butter cup?
faqs.a: Roughly 5 g total fat, with 2.5 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Do Reese's peanut butter cups have cholesterol?
faqs.a: Typically 0 mg cholesterol per cup, as they are dairy-free in that aspect.
